library.name: A Comprehensive Bibliography on Syriac Studies

Papers Collected on His 700th Anniversary (1318–2018), ed. Salam Rassi and Željko Paša, Orientalia Christiana Analecta 316 (Roma: Pontificio Istituto Orientale, 2024), 271–83.

data.title: Reconstructing ‘Abdīshō‘ of Gāzartā’s Personal Library: The Popularity of the Syriac Renaissance Literature in the Ottoman Time
data.abstractNote: This article discusses a short note written on the flyleaf of the manuscript SMMJ 116 by the hand of its scribe ‘Abdīshō‘ of Gāzartā (d. 1570), the famous poet and second patriarch of the Chaldean Church. This short text contains a list of books owned by this literary figure. The list gives us a rough idea of the books circulating among the educated Syriac church elite in the early Ottoman period.
data.bookTitle: Christianity, Islam, and the Syriac Renaissance: The Impact of ‘Abdīshō‘ Bar Brīkha. Papers Collected on His 700th Anniversary (1318–2018)
